sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine ‚Äî For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: That‚Äôs how people behave on the web in 2023. Some observations from real usability testing on what people do and what they don‚Äôt do on the web. From disabled copy-paste to magic link sign-in.
articles.title: The State Of Usability In 2023 üéä

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Let‚Äôs start into the new year with a little inspiration boost: wallpapers created with love by the community for the community. Happy 2023!
articles.title: Opening The Doors To 2023 (January Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ruslan Yevych)
articles.description: In this article, Ruslan Yevych will show you an easy way how to predict the appearance of a problem known as WCAG Failure Under 1.4.4 Resize Text (AA) while zooming the page. You will have a clear understanding of the possible risks of using responsive typography at the stage of development.
articles.title: Fluid Typography: Predicting A Problem With Your User‚Äôs Zoom-In

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alvin Bryan)
articles.description: No more random scripts in Python and JavaScript to transform CSV or JSON data. In this article, Alvin Bryan shows you how to use Miller, a small and powerful CLI tool, to do all your data processing.
articles.title: A Guide To Command-Line Data Manipulation

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nicolas Hoffmann)
articles.description: You may have already heard of CSS logical properties or RTL adaptations but are still deciding whether to deploy them widely. To help raise your awareness of their possibilities, Nicolas Hoffmann shares his experience of how he and his team at Proton carried out a massive move from CSS logical props to production and how you can consider them from a different perspective in your very own projects.
articles.title: Deploying CSS Logical Properties On Web Apps

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Thomas Bohm)
articles.description: In this article, Thomas Bohm shares strategies and methods to tackle some common graphic communication problems and gives you insights into how to improve accessibility and usability and make your designs much better.
articles.title: Useful Accessibility And Usability Examples To Help Improve Your Designs

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Masha Shaposhnikova)
articles.description: In this article, Masha goes over five tips that make it easier to manage a design system while increasing its effectiveness. This short guide is aimed at smaller teams.
articles.title: Taking The Stress Out Of Design System Management

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ashish Bogawat)
articles.description: In this article, Ashish Bogawat shares some of his favorite ways how to boost productivity and do things faster, better, and probably more fun by using efficient tools and workflows.
articles.title: Boosting Productivity For Designers With Efficient Tools

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Suzanne Scacca)
articles.description: Concerns over online privacy and security are nothing new. In this article, Suzanne Scacca explores how the right CSV importer can help businesses better prioritize user security.
articles.title: How To Prioritize User Security When Collecting Offline Data

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Heather Burns)
articles.description: All of us want to create inclusive, safe, and privacy-aware digital experiences, but where to begin? Our brand new Smashing Book, ‚ÄúUnderstanding Privacy,‚Äù written by Heather Burns, can help you lay the ground for future developers, designers, and project managers to build a better web for tomorrow. [Jump to the details](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/12/understanding-privacy-new-smashing-book/#about-the-book) or [get the book right away](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/printed-books/understanding-privacy/).
articles.title: Understanding Privacy: Protect Your Users, Protect Yourself

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: There is no universal solution for making every kind of table responsive and usable on smaller screens, so we have to rely on various patterns, which Adrian explains in this two-part series.
articles.title: Accessible Front-End Patterns For Responsive Tables (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Keima Kai)
articles.description: In this article, Keima Kai provides a brief history of AI in web design, explores its current implications for creativity, and offers suggestions for how web designers can stay ahead of the curve.
articles.title: The Future Of Design: Human-Powered Or AI-Driven?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: ‚ÄúUnderstanding Privacy,‚Äù the new Smashing Book by Heather Burns, will help you create inclusive, safe and privacy-aware digital experiences. Print books are now shipping! [Jump to details](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/12/understanding-privacy-new-smashing-book/#about-the-book) and [get the book right away](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/printed-books/understanding-privacy/).
articles.title: It‚Äôs Here! ‚ÄúUnderstanding Privacy,‚Äù A New Smashing Book Is Shipping Now

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Are you ready for the countdown to Christmas? This year, the web community was once again busy creating tech advent calendars jam-packed with fantastic content to sweeten your days. But which ones to follow? We help you find the right one, whether you‚Äôre a front-end dev, UX designer, or content strategist.
articles.title: Advent Calendars For Web Designers And Developers (2022 Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: There is no universal solution for making every kind of table responsive and usable on smaller screens, so we have to rely on various patterns, which Adrian explains in this two-part series.
articles.title: Accessible Front-End Patterns For Responsive Tables (Part 1)

articles.title: JavaScript Execution Context ‚Äì How JS Works Behind the Scenes
